pros: Great work-life balance. Professors are communicative. Work is rewarding.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Parkland, WA
pros: Good small school, nice people
cons: Sketchy neighborhood slightly off campus

pros: It paid for my housing
cons: Way too much work relied on the students to handle on their own, with minimal assistance from CDs

pros: flexible work schedule while at school
cons: uneducated boss and co-worker work there

pros: Very easy to work here as a student worker, lenient with working hours and just want you to work as much as it fits you.
cons: I think that the pay is not enough.

pros: Flexible schedule, Connections, Experience, Research

pros: Job is fun and the pay is decent. Making coffees, stocking items, etc is pretty simple and yet enjoyable.

pros: Great work experience, nice people

pros:
Small classes and nice people. 
Focus is on excellent teaching and not on research.
Much better than a large institution.
cons:
No money for anything. 
Terrible health benefits.

pros: Excellent benefits - lots of paid days off.
cons: Very low pay, not competitive!

review_title: Sloppy management, does not comply with COBRA
pros: Very friendly colleagues and students are fun to work with and inquisitive.
cons:
Business side of the university is sloppily run and poorly managed. Does not comply with all legal requirements and communication to employees is very poor. Best avoided at all costs.

Everyone within the university is traumatized by the university's lack of growth and the unwillingness of management to do anything proactive to try and grow the student population. Management is focused exclusively on excuses to explain why the university is shrinking (demographics and covid), but gives zero attention to the need to proactively lead the university into new areas where it can thrive by recruiting students.

job_title: Graduate Administrative Assistant in Tacoma, WA
pros: Wonderful people and relax job environment
cons: Job load can be less than you can think of.

pros: outside, work alone, gardening, fresh air, landscaping
cons: low pay rate, no raises, mis managed, lack of working tools

pros: It’s a nice community that feels comfortable
cons: The leadership is uncertain and the debt is outrageous

job_title: International Student Ambassador in Tacoma, WA
pros:
- Flexibility with schedule
- Networking and meeting new people
- Helping and serving new students
cons:

- Not so organized

pros: The environment is very friendly
cons: There are no cons to this job

review_title: Good place to work while a student
job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Tacoma, WA
pros: Employers work with your schedule to give you flexible hours. You can be a student first.
cons: You can only work 20 hours max, so for students that aren’t as busy, a second job might be necessary.

review_title: Undergoing difficult times; substance is being lost to "brand" and "marketing"
pros: Working with students can be wonderful when they take responsibility for their own learning and future.  There's a tendency at PLU to coddle students and that's detrimental to students.  While there can be opportunities for a subset of students to work closely with faculty (PLU promotes itself with this selling point), faculty are being asked to do far too much to have time to devote much time to all but the most promising, devoted students.  While there are some very good individuals at PLU amongst faculty & staff, they work within a very ineffective system.
cons: Leadership is lacking - both within the administration and the faculty leadership (chair and vice-chair). Decisions about promotions & tenure are based more in politics than merit. Academic standards are weak. PLU is undergoing severe budgetary problems due to declining enrollment and failure to retain students.  Discussions are ongoing about how to address the shortfall; solutions will likely include cutting both faculty & staff positions (some faculty searches have already been canceled).

pros: Work life balance is good
cons: Budget cuts are happening all over campus

pros: I was able to find accounting experience working as a student.
cons: I only received the minimum wage even though I was doing more than just busy work on a day-to-day basis.

pros: good for students, lots of flexible part time work available
cons: minimum wage, even for skilled positions.

pros: Free housing, making new friends and connections
cons: bad hours, lack of support

job_title: Garden Outreach Coordinator/Manager in Tacoma, WA
pros: Very student oriented. If I needed time off I could get it. If I wanted more hours I could get those as well. I was able to manage myself and get a lot accomplished because of this. I made my own hours and was able to pretty much do as I pleased. This allowed me a ton of growth.
cons: You can get away with too much. Many student employees would come in late or not at all and they would not be reprimanded. Also employees would say they worked so many hours a week while they worked substantially less. Management never came out to see how awesome I was doing.

pros: Plenty of hours and great barista experience that can be used later in life. Free coffee is also a huge plus! Also you get to meet quite a few people you may have never interacted before with on campus.
cons:
Management sometimes expects too much from employees when it comes to scheduling. They consider working there as an exclusive club and are resistant to hiring more workers to aid scheduling burdens.
There are also some workers who do not take their job seriously, thus increasing the burden on those who do.

review_title: Faculty at PLU are treated poorly by the administration
pros: Scenic and well-maintained campus grounds;
cons: Located in a high-crime neighborhood; very low salaries for faculty; faculty salaries across departments are not equitable; managers and administrators are poorly trained; no admissions standards for students; student evaluations are administered via old-fashioned pencil and paper, do not measure learning, are not weighed against average grade awarded for a class, and are returned very late; outdated classroom facilities.

review_title: It is a liberal arts school
pros: Working with students, beautiful campus, met some amazing people
cons: Some faculty and staff share a 'disconnect' from the real world, campus community promotes 'genuine self' but if students or staff lean conservative they soon learn to keep their mouths shut and their heads down

pros: Working as a peer tutor for the Academic Assistance Center at Pacific Lutheran University was a great student job. The hours are flexible and the bosses are kind. I found that tutoring others helped in my own studies.
cons: Sometimes it could be very quiet in the office, especially when no students were signed up for tutoring hours. In this case, tutors were supposed to help with administrative tasks, but if you worked outside normal office hours this wasn't entirely applicable, leading to a lot of down time.

pros: Good working environment, everybody was so friendly there. Especially, managers. Enhanced my working experience in general. Strict rules on sanitation. Not very hard on employees.
cons: Tasks are too simple to finish. Some employees steal foods out of the area. Some employees don't get their job done on time which delay the entire process of close-down.

pros:
* Answer keys were supplied in a timely manner.
* Clarifications for partial credit were also clear.
* Hours are flexible for graders. They just have to be logged manually.
cons: * Corrections for said answer keys, on the other hand, were sometimes not in a timely manner. This sometimes caused massive delays in getting the homework back to the students.

review_title: PLU is a fantastic place to work!
pros: Very supportive community with lots of professional development opportunities.  Able to complete projects with little or no supervision - trusted to do my job
cons: Pay was very low; upper management did a bad job communicating with everyone

pros:
Value
Work-life balance 
Travel 
Benefits Package
Amazing Team
University Outlook
cons: The pay is definitely on the low side. It's much easier to get an entry level job with higher pay elsewhere right out of college, but the value of the benefits package and the ethical payoff is nice. It's also a position that is easy to feel stuck within if you're not proactive about development opportunities.

review_title: Excellent alignment between the university mission and what we really do
pros: The people at PLU are extraordinarily student focused, unlike any other university with which I have had affiliation.  As a result, students experience a tremendously personalized education that exploits their individual strengths and neutralizes weaknesses.
cons: While research is rewarded, high teaching loads, coupled with the expectation to meet go beyond the norm for students make the balancing act more difficult to achieve a prominent research record.

review_title: It is an amazing place to work in higher education
pros: The best reasons to work for Pacific Lutheran University is the pride you get from the accomplishments of the students you work around daily.
cons: That it is in the suburb of parkland. The location of the college is not in the safest place in Tacoma.

review_title: This job was challenging yet educational of how floors and carpets are cleaned using environmentaly safe product's.
job_title: Floor Care Technician in Parkland, WA
pros: The time off you have is above average through out the year. You get to offer suggestions on how to improve performance and test new ideas and products.
cons: Unfulfilled promises and promotions on future goals. Poor managing of budget costs causing budget cuts through out the company.

job_title: Student PC Technician in Tacoma, WA
pros:
PLU I&TS has pretty good wages for part time student workers. They also have a good support network so you're never too lost on what to do. 

School always came first, so when I needed to take a shift off to study or make up homework that was always possible.
cons: At that position it's expected to work a decent amount of hours which can be taxing with school.

pros: If you're a student the IT jobs pay well and have flexible hours
cons: the management of the student techs is very poor, for a tech field it needs to start being open to new ideas on how to do things when they can be improved to save time and money, not just do it the same old way its always been done.

job_title: Student Worker At the Anderson UC in Tacoma, WA
pros: There are really fun cooks and staff members at the AUC! They not only help pass the time, but also teach you some cooking skills and life lessons.
cons: Some students don't take their jobs seriously, and won't follow DOH standards. You need to watch out for them.

pros: Students are eager and willing to learn. University supports travel to conferences.
cons: The provost, dean, chair, and faculty were constantly fighting over job duties and status. The university cut needed positions due to budget restrictions. Admissions is in disarray. They do not effectively recruit students.

job_title: Advising, Admission, & Student Support Coordinator in Tacoma, WA
pros:
Tight-knit community
Progressive values
Mission-driven, especially for social justice
Student-centered goals drive decision-making, not politics (for the most part)
cons:
Salaries leave something to be desired
Some employees spread too thin, as there is more work than staff to complete it

job_title: Student PC Technician in Tacoma, WA
pros:
If you're a student the IT jobs pay well and have flexible hours. The students are allowed to function independently on tickets which really shows how much management trusts their workers. 
The management of the student techs is great.
cons: Department is located in a basement

job_title: Director of Marketing and Communications in Tacoma, WA
pros: Great job for a student looking to leave college with a some great resume bullets
cons: It's merely a student job and while the work experience is nice its not going to prepare you for a real job per se.

job_title: Director of Transfer Admission in Tacoma, WA
pros: Outstanding benefits, great work environment, excellent people and constant contact with students preparing for great things - makes you feel young. Great place to work.
cons: Rising tuition costs. Same as every private college.

pros: Great sense of community and fun working atmosphere.
cons: The pay is very low compared to the "outside world" as it's a private University.

pros: Was able to develop my skills in an accepting environment and loved my co-workers
cons: Upper management has been around for many years, change can occur but is slow when happens

review_title: Good university with good people who are always there to help you out.
job_title: Student PC Technician in Tacoma, WA
pros: Staff is very nice and always available for questions.
cons: Don't get to code much software.

cons: Pay lower than peer institutions in the area.

job_title: Deputy Director of Junior Leader in Tacoma, WA
pros: Awesome place to work. Though I was not paid by PLU, I was paid my the Army.
cons: None that I could think of

pros: Very friendly environment. Students are bright.
cons: Salary not great. That may deter long term commitment.

pros: Great community, great people, laid back office style.
cons: Often times where double staffing is needed.

pros: the school had Good classes to offer and good teaching

pros: Freedom to Explore and develop your talents.
cons: Legacy can sometimes be overwhelming

pros: good position, nice friends, I enjoyed it.
